body: Hmmmm that's interesting. Does the GUI run just fine?

The GUI does execute the driver but it results in a different error; working on tracking that down if there's a driver issue?
```
kCreateInstance failed -9
vkCreateInstance failed -9
invalid gpu device
[!] ERROR: Subprocess 6196 exited with code 4294967295
[!] ERROR: Subprocess execution ran into an error
[!] WARNING: Terminating all processes
2020-11-21 03:02:15.324984 [+] INFO: Killing progress monitor
Processing: sample_input.mp4 (pass 1/1):   0%|                                                 | 0/456 [00:04<?, ?it/s]
2020-11-21 03:02:15.856245 [+] INFO: Killing upscaled image cleaner
Cleaning up cache directory: C:\Users\<user>\AppData\Local\Temp\2\video2x\tmpa71llagq
Cleaning up cache directory: C:\Users\<user>\AppData\Local\Temp\2\video2x\tmpgg5kw84x
Cleaning up cache directory: C:\Users\<user>\AppData\Local\Temp\2\video2x
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "video2x_gui.py", line 106, in run
  File "upscaler.py", line 802, in run
  File "upscaler.py", line 692, in run
  File "upscaler.py", line 347, in _upscale_frames
  File "upscaler.py", line 339, in _upscale_frames
  File "upscaler.py", line 409, in _wait
  File "upscaler.py", line 393, in _wait
subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command '['C:\\Users\\<user>\\Desktop\\video2x-4.7.0-win32-full\\dependencies\\waifu2x-ncnn-vulkan\\waifu2x-ncnn-vulkan.exe', '-n', '2', '-s', '2', '-t', '32', '-m', 'C:\\Users\\<user>\\Desktop\\video2x-4.7.0-win32-full\\dependencies\\waifu2x-ncnn-vulkan\\models-cunet', '-g', '1', '-j', '1:1:1', '-i', 'C:\\Users\\<user>\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\2\\video2x\\tmpa71llagq', '-o', 'C:\\Users\\<user>\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\2\\video2x\\tmpgg5kw84x']' returned non-zero exit status 4294967295.
```
Interestingly here the caffe driver works; wondering if there's something strange with the nvidia drivers on this cloud instance?

For those looking at this in the future the issue was with nVidia GRID; the feature needed to be enabled on the Compute Engine instance in GCP and the specific GRID driver needed to be installed for Vulkan to operate.
Typed too soon; while running the vulkan driver by hand now functions running the video2x CLI still results in the same error; GUI now works. I'm confused.

Have now confirmed the issue on a physical host that I've been working with for months with the GUI. Seems something is up with how the CLI version is determining its location to create the call to the vulkan upscaler.
I remember I programmed the GUI to always expand all paths into absolute paths. I'll have to check if the CLI isn't constructing the paths properly.

There has been a lot of changes in the past few versions.
Could you please verify that this issue still exists in the newest release?
Testing release 4.8.1 now; though for what it's worth the bundled CLI version has a banner saying 4.3.1

```
2021-01-28 20:17:06.440265 [+] INFO: Executing: dependencies\ffmpeg\bin\ffmpeg -hwaccel auto -y -i X:\other\upscale\ditch.gif -pix_fmt rgb24 x:\other\upscale\cache\tmpztgpmlhd\extracted_%0d.png
2021-01-28 20:17:06.455289 [+] INFO: Main process waiting for subprocesses to exit
2021-01-28 20:17:13.088962 [+] INFO: Subprocess 7304 exited with code 0
[+] INFO: Starting to upscale extracted frames
Cleaning up cache directory: x:\other\upscale\cache\tmpztgpmlhd
Cleaning up cache directory: x:\other\upscale\cache\tmpl1sc2v2z
Cleaning up cache directory: x:\other\upscale\cache
```
Very strange behavior now; hangs here.
Hmmm what? Do you have any error logs or did it not trip an exception?

That's where it stopped. after about 5 minutes I hit `ctrl-c` and stopped
execution. I didn't see any evidence that waifu2x-ncnn-vulkan was ever
invoked.

On Thu, Jan 28, 2021 at 11:46 PM K4YT3X <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Hmmm what? Do you have any error logs or did it not trip an exception?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/k4yt3x/video2x/issues/412#issuecomment-769571881>, or
> unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AIX4FPM65BTWJO4ZFTL3GCTS4I4TXANCNFSM4T5B6YYQ>
> .
>

That's bizarre... no output at all?
I don't have any good ideas at the moment.

on version 4.8.1 CLI, I get the original error 
```[!] ERROR: An exception has occurred
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "video2x.py", line 342, in <module>
  File "upscaler.py", line 1022, in run
  File "upscaler.py", line 849, in run
  File "upscaler.py", line 391, in _upscale_frames
  File "C:\Users\MICHAE~1\AppData\Local\Temp\_MEI510562\wrappers\waifu2x_caffe.py", line 90, in upscale
    os.chdir(pathlib.Path(self.driver_settings["path"]).parent)
FileNotFoundError: [WinError 3] The system cannot find the path specified: 'dependencies\\waifu2x-caffe'
```

The GUI does not seem to have the same issue. 

[video2x_d94dhlki.log](https://github.com/k4yt3x/video2x/files/6743558/video2x_d94dhlki.log)

I'm getting the same error as @michaelbonadio also on v4.8.1 (v4.3.1 CLI). For those that encounter this issue, a temporary fix was to provide the absolute path to the drivers inside `video2x.yaml`, i.e.

```
waifu2x_caffe:
  path: 'C:\Users\ItsMe\Desktop\video2x-4.8.1-win32-full\dependencies\waifu2x-caffe\waifu2x-caffe-cui'
...
```
i have the same error too on v4.8.1.
@GameTec-live post your error logs
its the same as the others, it cant find the dependencir of the realncnn shader, replaceing it in the yaml with an absolute path works

It's very rare that I get reports like this. Out of the hundreds of thousands of downloads, I only get a couple of people that encounter this problem. I suspect it's related to your locale or something else about your environment. What locale and OS version are you running it in?

windows 11 pro, 21H2
AMD Ryzen Threadripper 1900X 8-Core Processor     3.80 GHz
32,0 GB RAM
64 Bit
And the locale would be German
is there a nightly windows build available? maybe i can try that one?

> is there a nightly windows build available?

There isn't right now. 4.8.* is no longer maintained as I no longer have the dev environment. 5.0.0 doesn't have pre-compiled binaries for Windows just yet. Maybe try temporarily changing your locale to English and see what happens?

Hi i have a similar error:
![error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4932575/197679182-7aad812e-b5bb-4e85-b0e9-f9c69b919586.png)

Cheers

I have this error right now, 
`[!] ERROR: An exception has occurred
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "video2x.py", line 342, in <module>
  File "upscaler.py", line 1022, in run
  File "upscaler.py", line 849, in run
  File "upscaler.py", line 391, in _upscale_frames
  File "C:\Users\Technium\AppData\Local\Temp\_MEI51922\wrappers\waifu2x_ncnn_vulkan.py", line 92, in upscale
    os.chdir(pathlib.Path(self.driver_settings["path"]).parent)
FileNotFoundError: [WinError 3] The system cannot find the path specified: 'dependencies\\waifu2x-ncnn-vulkan'`

Does the path not look for the dependencies in wherever location I run the program from? Im running it on a drive that isnt the C drive, is this the problem?
